quoteFirst: Riding home in the Livery Hacks
quoteLast: , the Merry-Makers would be all in, but much gratified to know that Vienna and Paree had nothing on them as regards Rough House.
title: Ade's Fables
author: Ade, George, 1866-1944; McCutcheon, John T. (John Tinney), 1870-1949 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: He went straight to Charing Cross; he left the car in the yard and dashed in to inquire about trains; he searched a time-table; 12.59--3 o'clock--4.5 ... he looked up at the clock--
quoteLast: now. Micky dashed across the big hall to a gate where a signboard said "Dover Express"; he had no ticket; he pushed by the protesting inspector; the guard was waving his flag; some one grabbed at Micky and missed as he flung himself breathless and panting into the last coach of the moving train.
title: The Phantom Lover
author: Ayres, Ruby M. (Ruby Mildred), 1883-1955

quoteFirst: That an earthquake, or any peculiar expression of nature, should be timed to meet a special condition of the Church or the special purposes of a Providence, is not strange.  In such an event there really is no more wonder than that a man should set an alarm on his clock to go off at
quoteLast: in the morning.  Some men can swallow big things if you will only allow them to make out the author to be Nature.  But whether we attribute the things past to Nature or to God, we know that wonderful things have happened.
title: The Lost Ten Tribes, and 1882
author: Wild, Joseph, 1834-

quoteFirst: She was then in a sinking condition, with her starboard rail well under water. Firing ceased at
quoteLast: and the _Gyandotte_, her men waving and cheering, steamed slowly toward the defeated enemy and began to lower her boats.
title: For the freedom of the seas
author: Barbour, Ralph Henry, 1870-1944; Wrenn, Charles L. (Charles Lewis), 1880-1952 [Illustrator]

quoteLast: , we were wakened from a sound sleep by the roll of drums and the shrieking of half-a-dozen fifes: it was the Houssa “band” playing an untimely _réveille_. They were supposed to be playing that old point of war which begins “Old Father Paul came from the Holy Land,” but their acquaintance with it was limited to the first two bars, which they repeated over and over again.
title: The Land of Fetish
author: Ellis, A. B. (Alfred Burdon), 1852-1894

quoteFirst: Firing became general all along the line accompanied by a heavy bombardment of the whole position, so that evidently this attack must have been pre-arranged. Musketry and machine-gun fire continued without interruption till after dark, and from then up to
title: Sir Ian Hamilton's Despatches from the Dardanelles, etc.
author: Hamilton, Ian, 1853-1947; Wood, Evelyn, 1838-1919 [Author of introduction, etc.]

quoteFirst: The phenomena does not admit of a satisfactory explanation, but is doubtless connected with the daily variations of temperature and of vapour in the air. The mercury falls _naturally_ (so to speak) from nine or ten to between three and four p.m.; it then rises till between nine and ten p.m. It falls again
quoteLast: , and rises again about ten a.m. It is usually highest at nine a.m. and nine p.m., and lowest at three a.m. and three p.m.
title: Weather Warnings for Watchers
author: Anonymous

quoteLast: we had several 6  |29 .84 |    |    |  NNE  |        |       |showers of rain, but soon 7  |       |    |    |       |        |       |cleared off.
title: Account of a voyage of discovery to the west coast of Corea, and the great Loo-Choo Island
author: Hall, Basil, 1788-1844

quoteFirst: York at our head. We reached the desert
quoteLast: , and there we stopped. Far off to the east the long black line of gloomy forests skirted the horizon.
title: The twelve adventurers, and other stories
author: Brontë, Charlotte, 1816-1855; Hatfield, C. W. (Charles William), 1877?-1942 [Editor]; Shorter, Clement King, 1857-1926 [Editor]

quoteFirst: High wind, cloudy but no rain all day; have moved my tent down by the men's, so am quite comfortable to-night. The officer of the day came along
quoteLast: ; all was quiet along the line during the night. The countersign is "Mexico." My rations are getting very short.
title: Personal Recollections and Civil War Diary, 1864
author: Abbott, Lemuel Abijah, 1842-1911
